Class AbstractInventory

java.lang.Object
  AbstractInventory
All Implemented Interfaces:
Inventory
public abstract class AbstractInventory
extends java.lang.Object
implements Inventory

Defines an abstract inventory class. The AbstractInventory class is used to create an inventory system that keeps track of inventory lots. Lots are added when groups of items arrive at a warehouse. After lots are added to inventory, items can removed from the lots as they leave the warehouse. Exactly how the items are removed from the lots must be defined in the subclass. Once a lot is empty, the lot is deleted. The lots in inventory can be displayed along with the total cost. In addition, the inventory can be queried to find out the quantity of a specific item in inventory.

Version:
2007-09
Author:
J. Bigus

queryItemQty

public int queryItemQty(java.lang.String itemId)
Returns the quantity on-hand in inventory for the given item id. The item id may be contained in more than one lot in the inventory. The quantity on-hand is the total number of items with that item id across all lots in inventory.

Specified by:
queryItemQty in interface Inventory
Parameters:
itemId - the id of the item to be searched for in the inventory.
Returns:
the quanity on-hand.

remove

public abstract boolean remove(java.lang.String itemId,
                               int qty)
Removes a quantity of items from inventory. The items may be contained in more than one lot. If the total number of items cannot be removed, no items are removed from inventory. Once the items have been removed from inventory, if the quantity on-hand is zero, the lot should be deleted from inventory.

Specified by:
remove in interface Inventory
Parameters:
itemId - the identifier of the items to be removed.
qty - the number of items to be removed.
Returns:
true if the items were removed successfully, and false if all the items were not removed.
